titleStmt.title: Letter ca.254 BC
titleStmt.author: Phileas, accountant, 1 in Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, p. 434

msContents.summary: Letter of Phileas to Zenon recommending a certain Metrodoros and asking Zenon to make up a collective loan for Metrodoros from himself and his friends; the attire of Metrodoros will show that he is an important person

msItem.note: Written across the fibers with 5 lines; on the back, along the fibers, the address
Plate in P.Col. III facing p. 104

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from Dr. Kondilios through H.I. Bell in July 1925; no. 38 in Bell's inventory

div.ab: Phileas to Zenon, greeting. Certain of my acquaintances have come to me in behalf of Metrodoros, the man who is handing this letter to you, requesting me to write to you. You will, therefore, do me a favor by making him a collective loan from yourself and your acquaintances. It will be clear to you what sort of man he is from his dress. Good-bye. [Verso:] To Zenon.
